snippet: Jeb Bush is determined to run his all-but-declared campaign on his own terms, but he appears deeply conflicted about his brother’s war legacy.
abstract: Political Memo; perils that the Iraq War holds as an issue for Jeb Bush in Republican contest for 2016 presidential nomination mirrors in many ways how Hillary Clinton's vote to authorize use of force in Iraq haunted her presidential candidacy in 2008.

byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush is determined to run his all-but-declared campaign on his own terms, but he appears deeply conflicted about his brother’s war legacy.

headline.print_headline: Like Hillary Clinton in ’08, Jeb Bush Is Haunted by Specter of Iraq War
headline.main: Like Hillary Clinton in ’08, Jeb Bush Is Haunted by Specter of Iraq War

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research
